author: Knurmia
body:
<!--

For Windows PowerShell 5.1 issues, suggestions, or feature requests please use the following link instead:
- Windows PowerShell [UserVoice](https://windowsserver.uservoice.com/forums/301869-powershell)

If it is a bug report:
- make sure you are able to repro it on the latest released version. 
You can install the latest version from https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases
- Search the existing issues.
- Refer to the [FAQ](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/FAQ.md).
- Refer to the [known issues](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/KNOWNISSUES.md).
- Fill out the following repro template:

If it's not a bug, please remove the template and elaborate the issue in your own words.
-->

Steps to reproduce
------------------

Install PowerShell using instructions [here](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/powershell/scripting/setup/installing-powershell-core-on-macos-and-linux?view=powershell-6#macos-1012) or by downloading the latest version from [GitHub](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases)

Expected behavior
-----------------

Powershell can be started from Terminal

Actual behavior
---------------

The command that needs to be used is pwsh, which doesn't seem to be mentioned anywhere.

Environment data
----------------

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```powershell
$PSVersionTable                                                                                                                                          

Name                           Value                                                                                                                          
----                           -----                                                                                                                          
PSVersion                      6.0.1                                                                                                                          
PSEdition                      Core                                                                                                                           
GitCommitId                    v6.0.1                                                                                                                         
OS                             Darwin 17.4.0 Darwin Kernel Version 17.4.0: Sun Dec 17 09:19:54 PST 2017; root:xnu-4570.41.2~1/RELEASE_X86_64                  
Platform                       Unix                                                                                                                           
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}                                                                                                        
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3                                                                                                                            
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1                                                                                                                        
WSManStackVersion              3.0      
```

comments.author: mklement0
comments.body:
The first linked page says near the top:

> Once the package is installed, run `pwsh` from a terminal.

Generally, such issues are better raised in the [docs repo](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell-Docs).

Note that you now even get a direct `Edit` link on the published pages themselves, which allows you  to suggest edits (via pull request).

comments.author: thezim
comments.body: There was an issue with pulling some of the install docs over to the docs repo. Those are being addressed with https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell-Docs/issues/2166

title: PowerShell installation on OS X install /usr/local/bin/pwsh, /usr/local/bin/powershell
